0.text: 1) A reflexive pronoun used as an object comes immediately after a verb or preposition.
0.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>1) A reflexive pronoun used as an object comes immediately after a verb or preposition.</prosody></speak>

1.text: e.g. :- Why don't you sit down and make yourselves comfortable, so that we can start our discussion straightaway?
1.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>e.g. :- Why don't you sit down and make yourselves comfortable, so that we can start our discussion straightaway?</prosody></speak>

2.text: I'm sure we can make the English camp a success and be proud of ourselves.
2.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>I'm sure we can make the English camp a success and be proud of ourselves.</prosody></speak>

3.text: 2) A reflexive pronoun form can also be used to show the emphasis given by the speaker to a certain noun or pronoun.
3.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>2) A reflexive pronoun form can also be used to show the emphasis given by the speaker to a certain noun or pronoun.</prosody></speak>

4.text: Our art teacher himself designed the invitation for the Chief Guest.
4.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Our art teacher himself designed the invitation for the Chief Guest.</prosody></speak>

5.text: Our English teacher said that she herself would prepare them.
5.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Our English teacher said that she herself would prepare them.</prosody></speak>

6.text: Activity 1.3 A) Rearrange the words to form correct sentences to use reflexive
6.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>Activity 1.3 A) Rearrange the words to form correct sentences to use reflexive</prosody></speak>

7.text: pronouns as objects. 1. herself/blamed/what/she/for/happened 2. a/ I/ dictionary/ myself /bought 3. of /made /cup /himself/ he/ a /tea 4. a/ circle/ they/ in/ arranged /themselves 5. defended/ the/ dog/against /kitten/ our/ itself
7.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>pronouns as objects. 1. herself/blamed/what/she/for/happened 2. a/ I/ dictionary/ myself /bought 3. of /made /cup /himself/ he/ a /tea 4. a/ circle/ they/ in/ arranged /themselves 5. defended/ the/ dog/against /kitten/ our/ itself</prosody></speak>

8.text: B) Follow the example and mark with ^ the positions where you can
8.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>B) Follow the example and mark with ^ the positions where you can</prosody></speak>

9.text: use the word given within brackets. Copy them into your writing book. e.g. : I prepared meals^. / I^ prepared meals. (myself) I prepared meals myself. / I myself prepared meals. 1. She admitted that it was wrong. (herself) 2. My father grows these vegetables. (himself) 3. They built a house. (themselves) 4. The kitten cleaned. (itself) 5. We cooked the meals. (ourselves)
9.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>use the word given within brackets. Copy them into your writing book. e.g. : I prepared meals^. / I^ prepared meals. (myself) I prepared meals myself. / I myself prepared meals. 1. She admitted that it was wrong. (herself) 2. My father grows these vegetables. (himself) 3. They built a house. (themselves) 4. The kitten cleaned. (itself) 5. We cooked the meals. (ourselves)</prosody></speak>
